messages.message: Another question - different prompts here give us different answers. How can we have the system prioritize the current pay without specifically saying it? I ask because i am trying to run a converse multi-doc query to automatically calculate DTI within mortgages, and it keeps picking up the 2021 salary
the argument is that the system should know that the most recent monthly income is what he makes
in mortgage, you have to sometimes submit 2 W-2s - making this differentiation important

a few clarification questions
1. Is the answer in the second question "what saw his monthly pay in 2022) correct? (when the year is specified, the monthly pay is calculated correctly from the right document) 
2. Your problem is in the first question "where did you get his gross monthly income" -- that the system is picking up the income from an older file (2021)? 
3. Can you share the query that you use to get the "most recent income"? It's probably not these two in the screenshot

1. Yes - 2022 was correct, it just chased down the wrong number
2. Correct - when it is doing the DTI, it needs to look for how much a person makes a month, to then bump against their debts. It grabbed the wrong value in this case
3. The crux of the problem looks to be the issue of determining employment (attached query below). It is saying he's employed by Mesa, however he now works at FortisBC. If I ask for his current position, it is correct
Do you mind sharing the documents?
should be a good representation of docs that typically exist within a retail mortgage origination

If I understand this right the problem is the search result didn't take _the current time_ (or "_latest", "most recent"_) into account. When given the time explicitly in the prompt (for example, "what is Clyde's income in 2023"), the answer is correct; if the time is implied or implicit, the model doesn't know. Correct me if I'm wrong?

Yeah it'll be an interesting problem to solve. Thanks for sharing the files! cc @Hari I think this is a knowledge graph use case, and @Varun Jain on search in general

exactly -> some of the time, incorporating time awareness is important. For example, if i have a promissory note with a table that tells me what interest rates i pay based off of a specific date -> then having the model be able to understand that today is today, and relate that to the data in the page is how we get the answer
